Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6995.
Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

***This report contains sexually implicit information***

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(a) The types of children to be admitted for care.
(b) The services provided to residents and parents directly by the
institution and the services provided by outside resources.
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was raped by another youth at the facility where they were
previously placed over 1.5 years ago. Youth informed staff who did not
respond to the incident.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone, on January 24, 2023.
Complainant reported that Youth A “alluded” to the fact that she
recently had phone contact with Youth B. No other additional
information was reported.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone, on January 27, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said she placed at
Eagle Village for one year and was discharged from there to go into
independent living. Youth A said when she resided at Eagle Village she
was “dating” Youth B and made a plan with him to run away and spend
time together in the woods. Youth A said her intention was to talk with
Youth B and “break up” with him. Youth A said she convinced her peers
to make a distraction so she could run away without staff noticing right
away. Youth A said she met up with Youth B in the woods where they
spent approximately seven hours together. Youth A said she was telling
Youth B that she “did not want to do this anymore” and that she was
going to “live with his best friend” instead. Youth A said that made
Youth B upset. Youth A said it was dark and so she did not feel she
could get back to the house so she sat in the woods with Youth B.
Youth A said she made a comment that it was getting cold so Youth B
sat her on his lap to warm her up. Youth A said that made her feel
uncomfortable so she got off him and he began to kiss her, noting that
was consensual. Youth A said Youth B then turned around and forced
himself onto her and she told him to stop and that she did not want to
have sex, but he did not stop. Youth A said afterward she was “in
shock” and “stuck” for hours in the woods next to him. Youth A said
Youth B threatened her and told her not to tell anyone what happened
4

since she was older than him. Youth A said she eventually went back to
the house and went into her room and cried. Youth A said the following
day she told Youth C what had happened in the woods. Youth A said
the next time she had a therapy session she told Therapist 1 that
“things happened in the woods, I did not want to happen” to which
Therapist 1 told her not to go into details about it and told Youth A she
should not have run away and gone to the woods in the first place.
Youth A said she personally told at least two other staff however was
not able to recall who the staff were, what they looked like, or what she
told them. Youth A said she was “dissociating” frequently at Eagle
Village and has a hard time remembering anything from when she was
there. Youth A said eventually “all the staff and youth” found out what
happened in the woods because Youth B told everyone. Youth A said
Youth B told everyone they had sex and when anyone asked her about
it she responded that she did not want to have sex with him and he
forced himself on her. Youth A denied being given any medical
attention, pregnancy test, or STD test after the incident.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone, on January 27, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said he was placed
at Eagle Village for about fifteen months. Youth B said while he was
placed at Gerber house, he and Youth A were “in a relationship” for
“awhile”. Youth B said he and Youth A passed notes back and forth at
school and planned an AWOL together to be able to meet in the woods
and spend time together. Youth B said staff were always around and
watching so he just took off as fast as he could and “busted through a
door” and ran into the woods around 2pm. Youth B said a staff was
chasing after him however he was faster and was able to get away from
staff. Youth B said he met up with Youth A behind Ashmun house on a
trail by the “eagles nest”. Youth B said he and Youth A were out in the
woods until about 1am. Youth B said he lost his virginity to Youth A,
stating he remembered them kissing and then he “blacked out” and
when he “came too” Youth B was “riding him”. Youth B said it was
consensual sex however stated in the next week Youth A began to tell
other youth that he had raped her. Youth B said he discussed his
AWOL and sexual intercourse with Therapist 2 however never
discussed the allegations that Youth A made that it was
nonconsensual. Youth B said Youth D confronted him in the classroom
about having raped Youth A which upset him, and he said he went and
talked to Staff Z. Youth B said he told Staff Z that Youth A was
accusing him of raping her. Youth B said Staff Z listened to him and
talked with him however was not able to recall exactly what the
conversation consisted of.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone, on February 7, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth D said he was placed
4

at Eagle Village with Youth A and Youth B. Youth D said he remembers
a “couple times” when Youth B ran away from the facility. Youth D said
there were rumors after one of Youth B’s AWOL’s that he was
“drugged” by Youth A and they “did sexual acts” together. Youth D said
he never heard that the sexual acts Youth A and Youth B engaged in
were not consensual. Youth D said he never talked to either Youth A or
Youth B about the situation directly but rather heard it from other youth
at the facility.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on February 1,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth E said she
was placed at Eagle Village during the same time as Youth A. Youth E
said she remembers Youth A talking about her past sexual abuse with
a boyfriend, and an incident with a female peer touching her when
Youth A was out of bounds with her. Youth E said Youth A “dated” at
least four other youth at the facility. Youth E said Youth A AWOLed at
one point with Youth B however, Youth E never heard what happened
when they were AWOL.
Staff Y was interviewed via telephone, on February 7, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff Y said she worked at
Eagle Village with Youth A. Staff Y said she and Youth A did not have a
great relationship and Youth A rarely talked to her about anything. Staff
Y said she did not remember the specific AWOL with Youth A and
Youth B however did note that many youth were running out of bound
and AWOLing that summer. Staff Y said Youth A never disclosed being
raped by anyone to her. Staff Y said she did recall Youth A being tested
for sexually transmitted diseases and given a pregnancy test however
was not able to recall all the details surrounding why or when those
occurred. Staff Y said if a youth disclosed rape to any staff at Eagle
Village it would have been reported and the youth would be brought to
the hospital for an exam.
Staff Z was interviewed via telephone, on February 7, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff Z said he worked at
Eagle Village in the Gerber house with Youth B. Staff Z said Youth B
talked to him about other youth AWOLing and “doing stuff with girls” but
never disclosed any sexual incidents involving himself. Staff Z said
Youth B told him “he had feelings” for Youth A but that was the extent
of the conversation. Staff Z said if Youth B or any other youth would
report a rape to a staff it would have been reported to the authorities.
Therapist 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 1, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist 1 said she was Youth A’s therapist during her placement at
Eagle Village. Therapist 1 said Youth A had many sexualized behaviors
4

during her placement that she was addressing in therapy. Therapist 1
said Youth A had run away a few times and Therapist 1 recalled a time
when Youth A disclosed, she had sex with Youth B in the horse barn
under a blanket. Therapist 1 said she recalled Youth A having a
pregnancy test and STI check however was unable to remember the
exact details on who set them up and when they occurred as it would
have been done by the nursing staff. Therapist 1 said Youth A never
disclosed that she had nonconsensual sex with Youth B or any other
youth while placed at Eagle Village. Therapist 1 said if Youth A were to
ever disclose rape or any nonconsensual sexual touch to her, she
would never had told Youth A not to give her information and would
have made sure to fully address that trauma in treatment.
Therapist 2 was interviewed via telephone, on February 7, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Therapist 2 said he was
Youth B’s therapist at Eagle Village. Therapist 2 said he remembers
occasions with Youth B going AWOL and was able to recall talking to
Youth B about being AWOL with Youth A. Therapist 2 said Youth B told
him he has sex with Youth A and it was consensual. Therapist 2 said
he never heard that Youth B raped Youth A. Therapist 2 said if a youth
reported nonconsensual sex it would have been reported.
Documents Reviewed
• Youth A and Youth B’s placement records in MiSACWIS. Youth
A and Youth B were both placed at Eagle Village from May 24,
2021 and October 1, 2021.
• Youth A’s Updated Service Plan (USP) dated September 21,
2021, done by Eagle Village Therapist. Youth A’s USP reported
that Youth A had some concerning sexualize behaviors during
the months of June 24, 2021 through September 21, 2021.
These behaviors included running away from campus and
reporting she had sex with a peer, encouraging the female peers
in her house to touch her sexually, and talking about wanting
children in the near future. The USP noted that Youth A, was out
of bounds on August 8, 2021 and August 16, 2021, attempted to
run away on July 20, 2021 twice, and did run away on July 25,
2021, noting she disclosed that she has sex during that incident
to staff on July 29, 2021.
• Youth A’s pregnancy test results dated August 5, 2021. The test
was given by a nurse and results were negative.
• Youth A’s STI urine screen from Spectrum Health dated
September 14, 2021, with negative results.
• Youth A’s STI blood screen from Spectrum Health dated August
17, 2021, with negative results.
• Incident Report from Eagle Village dated July 25, 2021. The
incident report noted Youth A’s AWOL with another youth from
4

Gerber-Putnam program. The incident report noted that Youth A
reported that Youth A told staff she engaged in sexual
intercourse with this youth. The incident report indicated that
Youth A was going to be given a pregnancy test and STD test.
• Incident Report from Eagle Village dated July 25, 2021, reporting
Youth B’s AWOL from Gerber house. The incident report is
consistent with Youth B and staff interviews.
• Eagle Village Incident Reporting Policy and Procedure. The
incident reporting procedure outlines that an incident report
should be written for AWOL and sexual misconduct.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. Incident
reports were written for Youth A and Youth B’s AWOL’s. Additional
documentation was completed for Youth A reporting sexual intercourse
with Youth B. The facility provided the appropriate medical treatment for
Youth A after the incident. There is no evidence that Youth A reported
she was raped and it was not reported.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
_____________________________________February 22, 2023
Stephanie Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 22, 2023
____________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
